summary: Nearly all children in foster care are eligible for Medicaid. After they age out of foster care, usually at 18, most remain eligible for coverage until 26. Over 100,000 of these young people had Medicaid in 2023. But it's hard for some young people to maintain their coverage. For example, some may miss communications because they change addresses frequently. Others may avoid seeking help because...
title: Medicaid: Enrollment in and CMS Oversight of Former Foster Care Children Eligibility Group
